numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that the income rank of a parent can increase.
2. If the income rank of a parent increases then the chance of acceptance increases.
3. Legacy applicants have more than double the chance of acceptance compared to non-legacy students.
4. I looked again at the income rank 90 and higher.
5. At the income rank 90 and higher, the acceptance rate dips.
6. After the dip, the acceptance rate increases by a factor of 7.
7. People at the left end of the graph have greater chances of attending.
8. People at the right end of the graph have greater chances of attending.
9. Diversity applicants can have greater chances of attending.
10. Federal grant applicants can have greater chances of attending.
11. Elite rich people want to separate themselves from other people.
12. Therefore, the right side of the graph is not unexpected.
13. I wonder whether other local colleges would have similar graphs.
14. I wonder whether other community colleges would have similar graphs.
15. I wonder whether colleges at the international level would have similar graphs.
16. I wonder whether a survey in 10 years would yield the same results.
17. This situation impacts my community.
18. My friends are not legacy applicants.
19. I am not a legacy applicant.
20. Some of my friends try much harder.
21. Some students are chosen based on familial history.
22. It is hard for me to know that some students are chosen based on familial history.
23. The headline is: "Colleges are the new Alabama. Keeping it in the family".
